abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Lucknow-Muzaffarpur
            National Highway Project for India were as follows: outcomes
            were moderately unsatisfactory; risk to development outcome
            was moderate; Bank performance was moderately unsatisfactory
            and borrower performance was also moderately unsatisfactory.
            Some lessons learned includes: Institutional Strengthening
            agenda should be accorded due attention, especially in
            projects aimed at supporting large programs such as National
            Highways Development Project (NHDP). Task teams should pay
            particular attention to the performance of large value
            contracts. Significant delays here are likely to result in
            not only sub-optimal utilization of the loan amount but also
            more time spent by the teams and management on the Bank and
            client side.

repnme.cdata!:
India - Lucknow-Muzaffarpur National
            Highway Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the National Highway
            Project for India is for road users to benefit from an
            improved journey between Lucknow and Muzaffarpur. The
            restructuring involved removing the activities covered by
            the four poorly performing works contracts (comprising 155
            km out of 483 km of roads originally financed) from the
            project description and include additional activities which
            are; introduction of a new safer-greener highways pilot (55
            Km); strengthening of the Road Safety Cell (RSC) and;
            implementation of a new Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system.

display_title.display_title:
India - Lucknow-Muzaffarpur
            National Highway Project : restructuring (Vol. 2) : Data sheet

13057097.theme: Infrastructure services for private sector development,HIV/AIDS,Injuries and non-communicable diseases
13057097.majtheme: Financial and private sector development,Human development

repnme.cdata!:
India - Lucknow-Muzaffarpur National
            Highway Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Lucknow-Muzaffarpur
            National Highway Project (LMNHP) for India is to improve the
            journey on NH-28 between Lucknow and the Uttar Pradesh/Bihar
            Border, and to support National Highway Authority of India
            (NHAI) in improving safety and sustainability of the project
            corridor. The restructured project reflects the request from
            the Government of India (GoI) to remove activities that are
            covered by four contracts from the project description as
            well as include follow-up activities to the LMNHP action
            plan agreed between the Bank and NHAI in December 2008 (and,
            modified in January 2009) to address the unsatisfactory
            implementation performance of the project. The action plan
            included actions to improve progress on five poorly
            performing civil works contracts, construction safety,
            contractor and consultant performance, fiduciary controls,
            and also initiated a number of institutional development
            measures to support NHAI in strengthening program
            implementation. Implementation of the action plan has
            generally been satisfactory with the exception of progress
            on four of the five poorly performing works contracts. The
            original action plan and its implementation status as on
            March 2010 is attached as annex five. The revised action
            plan (annex six) presents and incorporates those actions,
            arising out of the present restructuring, primarily focusing
            on safety aspects and fiduciary controls and is part of the
            restructured project.

India - Lucknow-Muzaffarpur National Highway
